Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for...in Rome”
Reviews.Author: StephTravel16
Reviews.Content: Let's start off w/the good points: pastries,juice & coffee brought to your room in the morning, located near Termini station (having been to Rome before - we only needed 2 nights as stop over to other destination) and large washroom. Have to pay extra for less than efficient air conditionning unit (very loud and only cooled the immediate area where it was located) - not great when it's still in the 30c at night and humid. shared hallway with very noisy neighbours - had to get out of bed and tell them to 'shut up' - sounded like they were moving in-out all night...and for those of you who need to lug up suitcases, the rooms are located on 5-6 floors up (no elevator)...but the manager is accomodating and will help you out if you have questions concerns... - but I would find another place next time (we arrived late, and had to get up early - barely slept the nights there)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Josie H
Reviews.Content: Small tucked away place in a great location! No lift though, so go to the gym and work out before you arrive, or pack light! Lots of places to see around there and lots of places to eat. So close to the train station too so you can arrive from the airport train and walk over. The rooms do the job and are clean. I got a deal with a breakfast too which is simple but keeps you going. Friendly staff: one who speak more english worked mostly in the afternoon and evening so if you have questions, approach him then. Stayed there on a very tight budget and couldn't afford the extra 10Euro for the air-con. On the hottest night i was there, he offered me the air-con for free. What a dude!

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel but would look out for better options”
Reviews.Author: bachu1504
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel was very good as its close to Termini station.But the hotel doesnot have a lift,no room service,no fan if you are not using the air conditioner.Its a bit expansive for the service it provides although room was clean and well maintained

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: Tzanee
Reviews.Content: As this is only a two star hotel we didn't expect too much but we were less than impressed to be told shortly after arriving that if we wanted airconditioning this would cost us an extre €10 per night! The temperature during our stay in Rome was in the high 20s with high humidity so we couldn't manage without aircon and reluctantly agreed to this additional charge. However, I emailed our booking agent to (politely) ask if this was standard practice and got a reply the next morning saying that it was a mistake and that there would be NO extra charge for using the airconditioner during our stay and the price as quoted on our booking sheet was correct. We arrived on the weekend and I think that the person working reception didn't really know what they were doing, so I'm glad I checked with our booking agent. When we went out on our first day and returned to the hotel around noon, this same person told us we had to 'go away' again because our room hadn't been done yet and the cleaners were having lunch! We eventually got him to understand that we didn't mind if they came in while we were there, but this was clearly something he'd never come across before and he really wanted us to go away. Once the regular weekday staff were on, everything was fine and we found them to be quite helpful even though the language barrier was a bit hard to negotiate at times. But we managed with my little bit of Italian and their little bit of English to mostly make ourselves understood. Our room although small, was adequate, clean and fully serviced with clean sheets and towels daily. Breakfast was disappointing with just a croissant, a fruit juice drink, the usual dry rusk type bread and jam. We asked if we could have English Breakfast tea, but that was clearly beyond them and every morning we got Earl Grey tea bags - one each. Luckily we found a supermarket where we were able to buy some tea that we both like so we used those instead of theirs. The milk provided was hot and 'fluffed' as though for a cappuccino, but at least the water was properly hot. This was a surprise bonus as we'd found it hard to get really hot water anywhere else. The Meridiana is situated very close to everything, only about a 10 minute walk to the main station where you can catch local buses or the Hop On/Off buses that take you to all the main tourist destinations. I've read some really dreadful reviews about this hotel, but I think the secret is to realise that a 2 star establishment isn't going to give you much luxury and once we cleared up the misunderstanding about the air conditioning, we quite enjoyed our stay here. Because we didn't make a fuss and were always polite to the staff, we found them very willing to provide us with good service. We overhead some other guests getting really aggro because the WiFi wasn't working and they were implying that it was the receptionist's fault when it was clearly a technical problem and was probably corrected a bit later on. I really can't see the point in treating people rudely just because something isn't going your way. The golden rule is to treat others the same way as you like to be treated. We found it worked for us during our entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “A cosy stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Ashd28
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel very comfortable and cosy,the heating was on most the first night which left the room warm enough for the duration of our stay.We were able to reach all places on foot from the hotel and it was extremely handy for catching the bus to the airport.Staff are very friendly and helpful and a lovely woman brings you breakfast in your room in the mornings.Weren't alot of bad points, only thing was the view from the room,not very pretty but we weren't in Rome for the view so we didn't mind too much!Also,is no lift.A tip would give is don't leave the balcony door open too long as the smell isn't too good from outside but it's fine if keep door closed most of the time.Overall had a very good experience at this hotel,it is great value for money and would stay there again.Felt very safe in the area which is a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good overall location...”
Reviews.Author: bosseat
Reviews.Content: To start off, be aware that this hotel is located in a sketchy part of town near the "Termini" which is the train station. So if you are considering booking any hotel in this area its probably not going to be great. The lobby is located on the second floor of the hotel. The room my friend and I booked was supposed to have two twin beds, however we entered the room to see a queen bed and what looked to be a twin size bed. We then opened the windows and our room looked out into the back of a large, rundown apartment complex. I recommend not even opening the blinds if your room is on the back side of the building. At night it gets loud (again I can only speak from living in a room on the back side of the building) and in the morning you can hear just about anything move outside or above your room. The shower did not drain well and sometimes flooded although that tends to be the case around much of Europe. Also, there is no internet available in our room although there was an internet cafe around the block. The man at the front desk was pretty helpful for the most part and the hotel was in a good overall location, in terms of proximity to metro station and the coliseum. The staff at the hotel also allowed us to keep our bags at the hotel while we went sightseeing given our flight wasn't unti 9 P.M. There was always someone at the front desk as well which made us feel safe about leaving our room for long periods of time. This hotel was nice but I feel like there are better hotels out there that can offer better amentities. However, this is a good hotel for the amount we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Estrella91
Reviews.Content: This hotel is without doubt the worst I have ever stayed in, and I'm one of those people that always makes the ebst of things in hotels. Got there in the middle of the day to be told we'd have to wait four hours for the rooms to be ready. We were travelling in a large group of around 30 (school trip) and were split into 10 rooms. Each room was incredibly small, and rather dirty, but did have a fridge and a safety deposit box which we didn't have to pay for, but no air conditioning which we HAD paid for. Our shower door in the bathroom was broken, and wasn't fixed so we kept having to go next door to shower in our friends' room. The room was on the bottom floor with a large window that the maid kept leaving open even when we asked not to so anyone could have gotten in; luckily nothing happened though. We were staying there as a B&B and the breakfast food was terrible! It was just rolls, jam and bad fruit; no cereal or even a toaster. Rome itself though is amazing. The location of the hotel is fab for walking to the all the main attractions, although you probably will need to get a bus to the Vatican as that's quite a bit away. The bus service is very good though. Just beware of pickpockets in the streets and men hassling you to buy fake goods. Would go back to Rome, but not this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: bobby82
Reviews.Content: dreadful hotel when we asked where breakfast was we were taken to a cafe in the next street for a roll and coffee. They refused to accept anything but cash despite advertising they take visa. Room view was like Hitchcocks film rear window, please give it a miss!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Merdiana”
Reviews.Author: sunshine85NorthWales
Reviews.Content: Bang in the centre of Rome a couple of minutes from the termini station this is an ideal location for exploring & sightseeing the city on foot. It is walking distance from the colesseum, trevi fountain, roman forum, spainish steps & Imperial Rome. We only actually only caught a bus to Vatican city everything else was in walking distance. Was fab! Lots of shops and restaurants close by also. The room was small but lovely clean and an ideal base. Couldnt fault it! No breakfast or breakfast room exsisted, as we were told it did on the booking reservation. Only down side: - On arrival we informed the reception that we would be paying by credit card - They agreed it was fine. The day before we were checking out, we went to pay and they informed us the credit card machine was broke. And then decided they dont accept credit cards. The manager became quite heated with us and requested cash. We refused and insisted we would pay in the morning on check out with credit card. As i previously read in a travel book hotels try this as a tax dodge!!! Be aware. Following morning they accepted credit cards again - weird hey! They obviously knew they wud have credit card or nothing..... ha!

Reviews.Title: “One to miss”
Reviews.Author: keenvisitor
Reviews.Content: Our friend booked this hotel and it looked good on the web. It was on the wrong side of the train station in a very rundown area. The rooms were small and ours had dirty walls. Plumbing was excentric and there was mould on the ceiling. Spent as little time in the room as possible and would have left if we had booked it.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't recommend this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As another reviewer, we were also transferred to the (in)famous Hotel Bianca which is a really poor place compared to the rooms in Meridiana. They had the cheek to tell us the shower was broken in the rooms and nobody could stay there the first night we arrived. I immediately asked for a discount which was just laughed at!! In the end they gave us 10 EUR... Despite the showers not having worked the next morning our room was miracoulosly not ready yet and when I mentioned this they offered again the room without water! I'm sure there was no room without water at all. The room appeared to be nice once we could finally move into it but painfully small. Breakfast delivered to the room?? Well, we were taken to a small bar in the next street where we received our croissant and the worst cappuccino I had in Rome. On top of that I couldn't leave my luggage there until 6 in the afternoon because the guy who was at the reception only worked until 4pm!! And as someone else also mentioned credit card was not accepted so in the end we had to bring some cash. Rome is a lovely city but if you get treated like this at your accommodation (which by the way is one of the most expensive in Europe - I mean where else do you get a room at a 2-star hotel for 130 EUR???) it can really give you some headaches... I don't know about other hotels from this range in Rome but I definitely wouldn't recommend this one to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “They changed our hotel rooms without informing us - poor service!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights on the 24-25 and 29-30 of June 2005. The first 2 nights were reasonable - the rooms were new and decent, althought it was located at the deadend of a street. What really pissed us off was the fact that when we arrived on the 29, we were informed when we got there that as the hotel was full, they were placing us at hotel bianca instead, also another 2 star hotel but in a terrible state. construction was going on in that hotel, plus it was very very old!!! this totally spoilt out trip! and i am sure this was not the first time they did so. what is irritating is that we booked it via hostelworld, which would obviously state that the 4 -person room was available at that time, hence that was no valid reason why we were switched!! do not let this happen to you, DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: TelleGE
Reviews.Content: Located at the end of a dead-end street packed with hotels, you need to walk up to the second floor to find the reception. Good location, 7-8 minutes walk from Termini train station and good value. We paid 100 euros for a double room over Easter. However the room was really small and we were right next to the reception and so it wasn't the quietest room. Reception staff were not too friendly, we didn't feel welcome when we had question on the city or public transportation. "Breakfast" (fatty croissant, coffee + orange juice) is delivered to your room at the requested time. Overall the place was ok, ideal for tight budgets.
